properties.name: 6442 Sherbourne
properties.description: Posted by AptmanThis is where I lived for a whole 9 years, the longest I\'d lived anywhere in my life until my present home.

properties.name: Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by AptmanThis is the city I was born, who knows what the exact address is.This is the city where I was born. Who knows what the address was. I\'ll update it as I get more info from the parents at some time, or if I come across it through some stroke of luck or something.

properties.name: Cheap Berkeley apartment
properties.description: Posted by AptmanIt wasn\'t the prettiest apartment, but it was cheap (gottal love that Berkeley rent control, as absurd as it is) and it was pretty large. Lived there for a year and had a blast there. I think it was the same building - or right next door - to the apartment Patty Hearst lived in when she was kidnapped by the SLA. People\'s Park was right next door (not a great selling point, BTW).

properties.name: Mobile Alabama
properties.description: Posted by AptmanNo clue where in Mobile we lived, but live there we did for 6 months or so while my dad did some fellowship there.

properties.name: My first Berkeley Pad
properties.description: Posted by AptmanAfter so much fun in SB, I couldn\'t exactly go back to LA, too much concrete. So I moved to the Bay Area and Berkeley, where I lived in a really cool house with a bizarre older guy and 3 other boarders. He had a great house, and as long as I didn\'t have to interact with him too much, life was good (he wasn\'t that bad, but in small doses only). I didn\'t live there long, but it introduced me to the area.

properties.name: My first apartment
properties.description: Posted by AptmanMy first apartment in college, and anywhere, for that matter. Right next to campus, can\'t beat the convenience. It was small and not very nice, but damn it was neat living "on my own."

properties.name: My first college dorm
properties.description: Posted by AptmanThis is the dorm that I lived my first and second year in college. I actually lived on both sides of the hall in my first 2 years, but, what the hey, it\'s too much effort to put a marker on each side, so you get the point.

properties.name: North Hollywood - Home number 2
properties.description: Posted by AptmanRumor has it we lived here for a year or two after my dad finished his time in the military (he had been stationed in Florida, where I was born). Both he and my mom were originally from LA.

properties.name: Our Albany Home
properties.description: Posted by AptmanAgain, no clue where, but we lived in Albany for another 6 months after moving back to New Orleans.

properties.name: Our Home in Toronto
properties.description: Posted by AptmanI\'ve been back here before, so I remember exactly where it is, in Crescent Town in Toronto. Lived here for a year. It\'s where I learned to love hockey (how cliche is that?).

properties.name: Our apartment on Green Valley Circle
properties.description: Posted by AptmanWe lived here for a year as my dad began to establish himself - before they bought the house we lived in for the bulk of my childhood. That one\'s a whopping 3 blocks away from this one.

properties.name: Our house in New Orleans
properties.description: Posted by Aptman1716 elizabeth, metairieMy Dad did his residency in New Orleans, so this is where I lived as a little kid. I have few memories of it, but I do remember my sister being born there.

properties.name: The Abrego pad
properties.description: Posted by AptmanNow this place was the best place I lived in, even lived there 2 years (and could\'ve lived there forever if given the chance). Great roommates, great location, large, terrific for parties, had my own room. What can you say about it, it was just the best. Seems like every time I think about it I miss it.
